page.title: 04OCCUPATIONS
page.content: In 1931 virtually everyone in the area was employed either directly in the Manor or in agriculture on its farms.The same was true for the outlying areas of this block which reach almost to Turweston, Biddlesden, Shalstone and Mixbury,villages similar to Westbury. Today only a few workers are needed on the modern arable farms but in Westbury at least the manor still forms a focus for employment as it is now a private school with 15 teachers and at least the same number of ancilliary workers most of whom live in the village.Recently 1ntroduced jobs include a small car components firm,an adhesive and plastics factory and a retail outlet occupying rooms in the old mill. The remaining workers travel to the nearby towns of Brackley and Buckingham or even as far as London.
